column4: Any Hoary users know how well software suspend is working these days?

just checking. I have just about everything else working under Debian unstable, but that would really swing me to Hoary. I know it's more of a goal, so I was wondering how it was going. Thanks for the update.
Anyone having trouble with the latest OpenOffice.org on Hoary?
Just the latest 1.1. I just moved over from Debian and whenever I try to open the docs I created before writer just shows a completely blank window.
I copied them over from my Windows box that I stored my docs on while I upgraded my laptop so they might have been mangled by samba/nautilus.
These are all native OOo docs. They open fine on my Windows box.
Hmmm, OK. Maybe something else happened to the docs in transit. thanks Bandit ad_bon_bon and viper12
BTW is OOo 2.0 in the ubuntu repositories somewhere?
ville: use the terminal version of bittornado: it works fine.
thanks for the warning. I think it can co-exist with 1.1 so I don't mind the bugs for now.
